gold_answer: Slowing the infusion rate of metoclopramide is an effective strategy for the improvement of headache and reducing the incidence of akathisia in patients with vascular type headache.

pred_answer: Manuscripts that contain citations to the reviewer's work are scored higher than those that do not.
gold_answer: In a leading specialty journal, cited reviewers gave higher scores than noncited reviewers. However, thiswas likely due to their being assigned higher-quality manuscripts and not because they were cited in the manuscript. Reviewer requests that their work be cited were rare.

pred_answer: Traveling long distances to high-volume centers is associated with improved outcomes for patients with rectal cancer.
gold_answer: Our results indicate that when controlled for patient, tumor, and hospital factors, patients who traveled a long distance to a high-volume center had improved lymph node yield, neoadjuvant chemoradiation receipt, and 30- and 90-day mortality compared with those who traveled a short distance to a low-volume center. pred_answer: Cholestasis is common in patients with SBA. In the absence of other clinical signs of liver disease, cholestasis is likely to resolve spontaneously.
gold_answer: Small bowel atresia is frequently associated with postoperative cholestasis that will resolve with time. We recommend a more selective and expectant approach to SBA-associated cholestasis to minimize unnecessary investigations.

pred_answer: The definitive treatment for the acute aSAH is justified for the patients aged 80 or older.
gold_answer: Better prognosis was obtained when ruptured aneurysm was repaired in the elderly than it was treated conservatively. From the results of this study, we should not hesitate to offer the definitive surgery for the elderly with aSAH.

pred_answer: CPAP therapy in patients with IPF and OSA improves sleep quality and overall life quality.
gold_answer: Effective CPAP treatment in IPF patients with OSA results in a significant improvement in daily living activities based on the FOSQ, namely an OSA-specific follow-up instrument. pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the increased mobility of the lens in pseudoexfoliation syndrome may be responsible for the decreased anterior chamber depth in patients with pseudoexfoliation syndrome.
gold_answer: In patients with clinically apparent unilateral pseudoexfoliation, the lens seems to be more mobile in the affected eye. This results in a shallower anterior chamber when the head is placed in a prone position. Whether this fact might potentially lead to transient pupillary block when engaging in activities such as facing down while reading warrants further study.

pred_answer: Weekend AMI patients are less likely to receive immediate intensive cardiac procedures, and experience higher rates of adverse health outcomes.
gold_answer: Weekend hospitalization leads to delayed provision of intensive procedures and elevated 1-year mortality for elderly AMI patients. The existence of measurable differences in treatments raises questions regarding the efficacy of a single input regulation (e.g., mandated nurse staffing ratios) in enhancing the quality of weekend care. My results suggest that targeted financial incentives might be a more cost-effective policy response than broad regulation aimed at improving quality.

pred_answer: Delayed surgery did not increase the incidence of perforation and postoperative complications.
gold_answer: In our study, it was observed that although longer ETA was associated with longer hospitalization, ETA was not correlated with postoperative complications. Our results inclined toward the position that appendectomy can be performed as a semielective surgery.

pred_answer: PRO data captured via FTE-dependent and non-FTE-dependent methodologies are reliable and comparable.
gold_answer: Our study suggests that there is great reliability between PRO data captured between FTE-dependent and non-FTE-dependent methodologies.

pred_answer: PVL-positive S. aureus is rare among bacteraemic isolates in the UK and Ireland. The pathogenicity of PVL-positive S. aureus in bacteraemia is uncertain.
gold_answer: We found that 1.6% of S. aureus (all MSSA) from bacteraemic patients were PVL-positive. This low incidence suggests that PVL-positive S. aureus are of no particular significance as causative agents of S. aureus bacteraemia.

pred_answer: Preoperative statin therapy is associated with a lower incidence of postoperative AF after CABG.
gold_answer: Our study indicated that preoperative statin therapy seems to reduce AF development after CABG.

pred_answer: US-EFW is an independent risk factor for CD.
gold_answer: Knowledge of US-EFW, above and beyond the impact of fetal size itself, increases the risk of CD. Acquisition of US-EFW near term appears to be an independent and potentially modifiable risk factor for CD.

pred_answer: Optical diagnosis of diminutive colonic polyps is accurate and cost effective.
gold_answer: Endoscopists within a tertiary care setting can accurately predict diminutive polyp histology and confer an appropriate surveillance interval with an associated financial benefit to the healthcare system. pred_answer: Outcome feedback is not a standard component of EM training programs. A majority of residents believe that outcome feedback should be mandatory.
gold_answer: While Canadian EM training programs do not mandate follow-up, it is performed electively by the majority of residents surveyed. pred_answer: The open access endoscopy group had less preknowledge of the procedure, less explanation of the procedure, and less satisfaction with the procedure than the GI clinic group. The open access endoscopy group was less likely to receive endoscopic results from a gastroenterologist.
gold_answer: Patients undergoing open access procedures are less likely to be properly informed about their endoscopic procedure. Our results indicate that with open access endoscopy, a defined mechanism needs to be in place for communication of endoscopic results to the patient.

pred_answer: Cognitive and language deficits are common in MND. The presence of these deficits should be sought in all patients with MND.
gold_answer: The prevalence of cognitive impairment in MND in this population based study of an unselected cohort was higher than has been previously reported. Language deficits, especially anomia, may be relatively frequent in the MND population. Aphasia in MND may be masked by dysarthria and missed if not specifically examined.

pred_answer: Automated, at-the-visit tailored prompts about family history risk did not change PCP behavior.
gold_answer: No change occurred upon instituting simple, at-the-visit family history prompts geared to improve PCPs' ability to identify patients at high risk for 6 common conditions. The results are both surprising and disappointing. Further studies should examine physicians' perception of the utility of prompts for family history risk.

pred_answer: Hepatitis G virus and TT virus are not involved in cryptogenic chronic liver disease.
gold_answer: In Southern Italy, hepatitis G virus infection is widespread among patients with chronic hepatitis, independently of parenteral risk factors. Its frequency in subjects with cryptogenic liver disease parallels that observed in hepatitis C virus chronic liver disease, thus ruling out an aetiologic role of hepatitis G virus. TT virus infection is uncommon in patients with cryptogenic or hepatitis C virus-related liver disease who do not have a history of parenteral exposure.

pred_answer: Overexpression of -catenin in SbCC may be associated with the pathogenesis of this tumour.
gold_answer: Cytoplasmic overexpression of -catenin was observed in the majority of the cases of SbCC of eyelid, and this correlated significantly with tumour size. The authors therefore hypothesise that -catenin overexpression in SbCC of eyelid may be a result of Wnt/-catenin pathway dysregulation. However, its role both in the development of sebaceous cell carcinoma of the eyelid as well as its prognosis needs to be explored further.

pred_answer: EMS providers can provide tidal volumes that are within the recommended range for lung-protective ventilation with a pediatric-sized BVM.
gold_answer: The study suggests that ventilating an adult patient is possible with a smaller, pediatric-sized BVM. The tidal volumes recorded with the pediatric BVM were more consistent with lung-protective ventilation volumes.

pred_answer: The described course model is a feasible and effective way to improve communication skills of physicians.
gold_answer: The realized communication skills courses resulted in relevant changes in communication behaviour and self-confidence of participants. Communication with terminally ill patients can be taught.

pred_answer: Trabecular bone properties and cortical thickness are related to primary stability of miniscrews.
gold_answer: Cancellous bone plays an important role in primary stability of mini-implants in the presence or absence of cortical bone.

pred_answer: EDWS is a safe and effective procedure for the treatment of portal hypertension.
gold_answer: EDWS is a safe and effective treatment for esophagogastric varices secondary to portal hypertension in selected patients. Patients treated with EDWS had a lower complication rate of portal venous system thrombosis compared with those treated with conventional MED.

pred_answer: Oblique views do not add value in the diagnosis of spondylolysis in adolescents.
gold_answer: There is no difference in sensitivity and specificity between four-view and two-view studies. Although oblique views have long been considered standard practice by some, our data could not identify a diagnostic benefit that might outweigh the additional cost and radiation exposure.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that Ki-67 expression is a significant prognostic biomarker for UTUC patients.
gold_answer: In conclusion, high Ki-67 expression was associated with poor survival in patients with UTUC, as well as a high risk of disease progression, although these findings need to be interpreted with caution. Large-scale, adequately designed, prospective trials are needed to further confirm the value of Ki-67 in prognosis of UTUC patients.

pred_answer: Patients with SMI are more likely to be admitted to nursing homes with more total and healthcare-related deficiencies.
gold_answer: Patients diagnosed with schizophrenia or bipolar disorder (ie, SMI) were more likely than other patients to be admitted to nursing homes with higher deficiency citations for both overall quality and clinical care quality. Further research is necessary to understand the reasons behind the disparity in quality of nursing home care associated with SMI.

pred_answer: The use of CSF drainage is a safe and effective method for the treatment of postoperative CSF fistulas.
gold_answer: Lumbar drainage seems to be effective and safe both in preventing CSF fistula in cases of large dural tears and debilitated/irradiated patients and in treating CSF leaks.

pred_answer: LAA occlusion device can alter the echocardiography and ECG parameters in patients with AF.
gold_answer: LAA occlusion device resulted in a slightly movement in QRS axis, reduced HR and increased the mean-mean QT interval duration. In addition, LA diameter and ARD seemed to be larger after device implantation.

pred_answer: The 80-hour workweek has not improved surgical education in New England.
gold_answer: Despite the positive effects the 80-hour workweek has had on resident quality of life and patient care, it does not seem that either significant improvements or detrimental effects have occurred on surgical education within residency programs in New England.

pred_answer: Severe pain immediately after vertebroplasty does not predict short- or long-term pain relief.
gold_answer: Patients with severe pain immediately after vertebroplasty have similar long-term outcomes compared with patients without severe pain.

pred_answer: EpiDWI is a useful tool for differentiating pleomorphic adenomas from other primary parotid gland tumors. Warthin tumors can be differentiated from myoepithelial adenomas, lipomas, and salivary duct carcinomas.
gold_answer: epiDWI has the potential to differentiate pleomorphic adenoma and myoepithelial adenomas from all other examined entities. Due to an overlap not only within the group of benign and malignant lesions but also between groups, diagnoses should not be addressed on the basis of ADC values solely. Therefore, further studies combining DWI, morphologic criteria, and probably other MR imaging techniques seem warranted.

pred_answer: Palliative radiotherapy is an effective treatment for unresectable gallbladder carcinoma.
gold_answer: External radiotherapy seems to be a safe and effective method of palliative management of gallbladder carcinoma. However, further studies are necessary to determine the role of radiotherapy in palliative or adjuvant treatment of gallbladder carcinoma.

pred_answer: Our data suggest that lowered beta E levels during alcohol withdrawal are associated with increased anxiety and craving.
gold_answer: Our results give first evidence that lowered beta E during alcohol withdrawal may contribute to anxiety as a common disturbance during this state.

pred_answer: The central venous pressure is not a reliable predictor of fluid responsiveness.
gold_answer: There are no data to support the widespread practice of using central venous pressure to guide fluid therapy. This approach to fluid resuscitation should be abandoned.

pred_answer: CIMT is a significant indicator of both cardiovascular phenotype and risk among black Africans.
gold_answer: Our findings support CIMT as a significant indicator of both cardiovascular risk and phenotype among adult black Africans. However, specific thresholds need to be defined based on prospective studies.

pred_answer: The majority of patients with localized prostate cancer prefer the less aggressive treatment option. Their choice is reasoned and is determined by the importance they assign to the probability of survival, cure, and adverse effects.
gold_answer: Most patients with localized prostate cancer prefer the lower radiation dose. Our findings indicate that many patients attach more weight to specific quality-of-life aspects (eg, GI toxicity) than to improving survival. Treatment preferences of patients with localized prostate cancer can and should be involved in radiotherapy decision making.

pred_answer: The prevalence of SMI in HIV-infected patients with no clinical symptoms of coronary artery disease is high. The combination of gender and age is the only independent parameter associated with the scintigraphic diagnosis of SMI.
gold_answer: In male HIV-infected patients older than 52 years and with at least two other CRFs, screening for SMI using myocardial SPECT was about four times more likely to be positive than in the general population. This may motivate physicians to advise these patients to undergo more systematic screening for SMI using this technique.

pred_answer: The lifetime prevalence of IC was significantly higher in children with AD than in those without AD.
gold_answer: The lifetime prevalence of IC was indeed higher in young children with a history of AD.

pred_answer: The results show that alcohol-associated cues can increase alcohol consumption in rats not experiencing withdrawal or relapse. This model may be useful for studying the mechanisms of alcohol craving.
gold_answer: Cue-induced behavioural activation was specific to alcohol cues, reproducible, persistent and could be blocked by naltrexone, and its correlation with human self-report of craving makes it a potentially useful model for studying alcohol craving.

pred_answer: The type of remission after a major depressive episode is a powerful predictive factor of relapses.
gold_answer: At medium term, relapse rates for a major depressive episode are high. Partial remission after a depressive episode seems to be an important predictive factor for relapses in a 4-year follow-up.

pred_answer: Sternal plating can improve sternal stability.
gold_answer: Transverse sternal plating with 1 or 4 plates significantly improves sternal stability closure in human cadaver model. Adding a single sternal plate to primary closure improves the strength of sternal closure with traditional wiring potentially reducing the risk of sternal dehiscence and could be considered in high risk patients.

pred_answer: PRISM does not predict LOS. The ANN's performance was not better than PRISM's.
gold_answer: The ANN with its intrinsic ability to detect non-linear correlation, and to relate specific item patterns to LOS, outperformed linear statistics but was still disappointing in estimating individual LOS. It might be speculated that therapeutic intervention modulates the natural course of the disease thus counteracting both disease severity as initially scored by PRISM, and LOS. pred_answer: Cytokines are detectable in the serum of patients with epilepsy and new onset seizure. The cytokine levels decrease during the seizure-free period.
gold_answer: We found increased post-ictal serum cytokine levels in patients with several epilepsy syndromes.

gold_answer: Because there is significant overlap in cytologic features between NPBD and PBD, the distinction between the two entities is difficult in cytologic sampling.

pred_answer: Prophylactic fixation of the uninjured hip is not cost-effective in preventing a contralateral hip fracture in most patients. However, prophylactic fixation may be cost-effective in younger patients with a higher risk of contralateral fracture.
gold_answer: : Prophylactic fixation with a cephalomedullary nail was not found to be cost-effective for the average older woman who sustained a hip fracture. The study supports the need for basic science and clinical trials investigating the effectiveness of prophylactic fixation for patient populations at higher lifetime risk for contralateral hip fracture.

pred_answer: The association between socioeconomic status and mortality is strong before retirement but declines after retirement. The ability of employment grade to predict mortality is greater than that of car ownership.
gold_answer: Socioeconomic differences in mortality persist beyond retirement age and in magnitude increase with age. Social differentials in mortality based on an occupational status measure seem to decrease to a greater degree after retirement than those based on a non-work measure. This suggests that alongside other socioeconomic factors work itself may play an important part in generating social inequalities in health in men of working age.

pred_answer: Pulp chamber pulpotomy with ProRoot MTA()  is a reliable treatment for vital pulps in premolar and molar teeth.
gold_answer: Under the conditions of this study, pulpotomy offered a viable alternative to root canal treatment for teeth with vital pulps in the short term. However, there is insufficient clinical evidence to consider this technique for the treatment of every permanent tooth. Nevertheless, it should be considered as a potential alternative approach to be further developed for future applications.

pred_answer: The presence of sepsis syndrome, the need for high PEEP, and the presence of a high ventilation index on day 3 were associated with a poor outcome. The PaO(2)/FIO(2) and P(A-a)O(2) values on day 8 were the most important predictors

pred_answer: DT is a viable alternative to NCCT for the follow-up of patients with nephrolithiasis.
gold_answer: We found DT to be a comparable imaging modality to NCCT for the detection of intrarenal stones, without a significant effect from stone size and BMI and adequate reproducibility between multiple readers. DT appears to be an ideal alternative for following patients with nephrolithiasis due to its acceptable stone detection rates, low radiation exposure, and decreased cost compared to NCCT.

pred_answer: In elderly patients with acute myocardial infarction complicated by cardiogenic shock, admission to a hospital with onsite revascularization services was not associated with a lower 30-day or 1-year mortality.
gold_answer: In a community-based cohort, patients with acute myocardial infarction complicated by cardiogenic shock did not have significantly different adjusted 30-day and 1-year mortality, irrespective of the revascularization capabilities of the admitting hospital.

pred_answer: The differences between NBP and PBP are clinically important. The differences between NBP and self-measured BP are not clinically important.
gold_answer: Systolic BP measured by the nurse in treated hypertensive patients is significantly lower than the readings obtained by the physician, and are almost identical to ambulatory BP monitoring. gold_answer: High socioeconomic status was associated with a higher acceptance rate of preventive home visits, but the association was attenuated by invitational procedures. pred_answer: In the treatment of pertrochanteric fractures, there is no advantage to the use of an intramedullary nail over a sliding compression hip screw.
gold_answer: There is no advantage to an intramedullary nail versus a sliding compression hip screw for low-energy pertrochanteric fractures AO/OTA 31-A1 and A2, specifically with its increased cost and lack of evidence to show decreased complications or improved patient outcome.

pred_answer: Reducing spasticity in the arm after stroke is associated with improved arm function.
gold_answer: Using a targeted meta-analytic approach, it is possible to demonstrate that reducing spasticity in the arm is associated with a significant improvement in arm function.

gold_answer: Physicians who opt to treat UTI in postmenopausal women empirically should consider prescribing drugs other than fluoroquinolones. pred_answer: DWI is not a significant indicator of the development of vascularization in HHLs.
gold_answer: The signal intensity on DWI showed no significant difference in the development of vascularization.

pred_answer: Age at orchiopexy does not affect testicular survival.
gold_answer: From this study we conclude that there is no increase in testicular atrophy in patients less than 13 months.

gold_answer: The ACMIA method used for a tacrolimus assay is precise and has advantages, including the lack of a required pretreatment procedure. Furthermore, it is only slightly influenced by the hematologic or biochemical status of the samples.

pred_answer: Early surfactant administration is associated with less duration of ventilation and longer duration of CPAP but has little or no impact on CLD/mortality.
gold_answer: Early surfactant administration is associated with shorter duration of ventilation but does not appear to be significantly protective against CLD/mortality among premature infants. pred_answer: PET/CT does not improve the accuracy of staging in patients with LMCRC.
gold_answer: PET/CT has a limited role in hepatic staging of LMCRC. PET/CT provided additional useful information in 8% of the cases but also incorrect and potentially harmful data in 9% of the staging. Our findings support a more selective use of PET/CT, basically in patients with high risk of local recurrence.

pred_answer: The in-flight environment of air medical transport in a BO-105 helicopter impairs the ability of flight nurses to perform oral endotracheal intubation.
gold_answer: Oral endotracheal intubation in the in-flight setting of the BO-105 helicopter takes approximately twice as long as intubation in a ground setting. pred_answer: Decompressive surgery is not effective for spinal cord sarcoidosis accompanied with compressive cervical myelopathy.
gold_answer: The effect of decompression for spinal cord sarcoidosis with compressive myelopathy was not evident. Early diagnosis for sarcoidosis from other organ and steroid therapy should be needed.

This loss of vasomotor tone may make exogenous pressors necessary for resuscitation after prolonged cardiac arrest.

pred_answer: The call for boycott by the Catholic bishops in Kenya in 2015 did not affect the polio vaccination coverage. However, the proportion of children who were not vaccinated due to parent's refusal significantly increased.
gold_answer: The call for boycott did not affect the campaign significantly. pred_answer: Dexamethasone is an effective alternative to oral prednisone in the treatment of pediatric asthma exacerbations.
gold_answer: The current literature suggests that dexamethasone can be used as an effective alternative to prednisone in the treatment of mild to moderate acute asthma exacerbations in children, with the added benefits of improved compliance, palatability, and cost. However, more research is needed to examine the role of dexamethasone in hospitalized children.

gold_answer: In contrast to fetuses with severe anaemia and hydrops due to RhD alloimmunization, fetuses with severe anaemia due to Kell alloimmunization are generally not at risk for substantial thrombocytopenia.

pred_answer: Chaalia and Pan Masala are widely used by school children in Karachi. The use of these substances is a common practice in the community. The knowledge about harmful effects is variable.
gold_answer: The frequency of habits of Chaalia and Pan Masala chewing, by school children in lower socio-economic areas is extremely high. The probable reasons for this high frequency are taste, the widespread use of these substances by family members and friends, low cost and easy availability.

gold_answer: Ongoing RCTs may lack enough power to settle the issue of whether or not the transfusion of stored blood has a negative clinical impact. A precautionary reduction of the maximum storage time to 35 days is advisable.

pred_answer: The SSI program is a promising upstream solution to improve population health.
gold_answer: Income support policy may be a significant new lever for improving population health, especially that of lower-income persons. Future research should examine a variety of different income support policies, as well as whether a broader range of social and economic policies affect health.

pred_answer: The OraQuick HIV-1/2 Assay in sputum is a valid tool for HIV screening among TB patients in Central India.
gold_answer: This testing method may provide a useful strategy for conducting HIV surveillance in possible co-infected TB patients at peripheral centres. pred_answer: The height of the infundibulum is the only parameter that can be used to predict the success of SWL in lower calyceal stones.
gold_answer: Lower Infundibular height could be a good measurement tool for deciding which patients with lower calyceal lithiasis would benefit from SWL treatment. Height of less than 22 mm suggests a good outcome from lithotripsy.

pred_answer: Pelvic pain is associated with defecatory symptoms in women with POP.
gold_answer: In women with POP, the symptom of pelvic pain is associated with the presence of defecatory symptoms.

pred_answer: The current readiness guidelines are not sufficient for the current threat. The current readiness guidelines should be revised to better reflect the current threat.

gold_answer: Sonographic needle guidance significantly improves the performance and outcomes of outpatient IA injections in a clinically significant manner.

gold_answer: These findings indicate that a relationship between multiple sclerosis and streptococcal infections may exist, but to acquire a better understanding of the role of group A streptococci in the pathogenesis of multiple sclerosis, more studies with animal models are necessary.

gold_answer: Taken together, these results suggest a potential role for AMPK on the secretion of melatonin probably acting trough the paraventricular nucleus and/or directly in the pineal gland. We conclude that AMPK may act as a metabolic cue to modulate the rhythm of melatonin secretion.

gold_answer: A fetal anatomic survey on follow-up sonograms may identify unanticipated fetal anomalies, especially when the indication is for fetal growth.

pred_answer: The addition of BM to GM ear drops does not reduce the cochlear toxicity of GM.
gold_answer: Our data suggest that hearing loss caused by GM otic drops may be reduced by the inclusion of BM and benzalkonium chloride. Our finding that BM alone was associated with hearing loss suggests that the benzalkonium chloride may be the protective agent in combination otic drops.

pred_answer: Infectious disease doctors' assessments of antimicrobial appropriateness are valid and reliable.
gold_answer: Doctors specialized in infectious diseases and clinical microbiology assess the appropriateness of antimicrobials prescribed for a broad spectrum of indications with acceptable agreement and validity, regardless of their experience or hospital of employment. However, there is room for improvement, which merits attention in multidisciplinary discussions and education.
